channel.title: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
channel.description: The Moscow Times offers everything you need to know about Russia: Breaking news, top stories, business, analysis, opinion, multimedia, upcoming cultural events

item.title: Women Athletes Power Russian Olympic Committee Team to Medals in Tokyo
item.description: The ROC has snapped up 12 medals after three days of competition.

item.title: Russia Blocks 49 Navalny-Linked Websites, Allies Say
item.description: The blocked sites include the jailed Kremlin critic's personal website as well as those of lawyer Lyubov Sobol and Navalny's regional network.

item.title: Russia to Pay 1.1Bln Euros Per Year Under EU Carbon Tax – Reports
item.description: Russia will likely pay more taxes to the EU than any other country, RBC cited its calculations as saying.

item.title: Russia Eyes Free-Trade Zone on Islands Disputed by Japan
item.description: Japan issued a protest over Prime Minister Mishustin's visit to the Kuril Islands.

item.title: Libya to Probe Delayed Sputnik V Deliveries – Reports
item.description: The country is waiting for 500,000 second doses.

item.title: Coronavirus in Russia: The Latest News | July 26
item.description: Record-setting deaths. Moscow cases soar. Mandatory vaccination.

item.title: News From Russia: What You Missed Over the Weekend
item.description: Boasts of prowess. Aid to Cuba. Olympic medals.

item.title: Putin Warns of 'Lethal' Strikes at Russian Warship Parade
item.description: The Russian leader's boast comes days after military officials announced tests of advanced new weapons.

item.title: Russia Sends Aid to Cuba After Anti-Government Protests
item.description: The cargo included food, personal protective equipment and more than 1 million medical masks.

item.title: Karpin Takes Over as Russia Football Manager
item.description: Karpin's predecessor was sacked after Russia was eliminated in the group stage of Euro 2020.

item.title: U.S., Russia to Hold New Talks to Encourage Stability
item.description: The so-called Strategic Stability Dialogue will take place July 28 amid U.S-Russian tensions on multiple fronts.

item.title: Russia Calls Taliban ‘Rational,’ Blames Afghan Gov’t for Blocking Talks
item.description: Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said the Taliban delegation promised not to threaten ex-Soviet Central Asian states and to fight the Islamic State.

item.title: Russian Olympic Team’s Vaccinations Lag Other Countries’ Rates
item.description: Just half of Russia’s athletes have had their jabs.

item.title: Russian State TV Cuts from Ukraine to Ad in Olympic Opening Ceremony Broadcast
item.description: Channel One says the omission was a scheduled commercial break, not a snub.

item.title: Russian Investigative News Site The Insider Added to ‘Foreign Agents’ List
item.description: The outlet is known for its work with Bellingcat on investigations into the poisonings of Alexei Navalny and former spy Sergei Skripal.

item.title: Russia on Track to Deliver Fighter Jets to Myanmar – Reports
item.description: Russia will deliver Su-30 jets and Yak-130 training aircraft to Myanmar's military junta, a top defense cooperation official reportedly said.

item.title: No Plea Bargain in Treason Case, Russian Ex-Journalist Safronov Says in Since-Deleted Column
item.description: “I’ve made my choice: No deals whatsoever,” Ivan Safronov wrote of the treason investigation he says is unfounded.

item.title: No Flag, No Anthem, But Russia Olympic Chief Still Wants Tokyo Golds
item.description: The head of Russia's Olympic Committee believes his athletes are headed to the Tokyo Games with an unfair disadvantage.

item.title: Divorce in Russia Reaches 7-Year High – MBKh Media
item.description: Russia's conservative, Muslim-majority regions in the North Caucasus saw the biggest increases.

item.title: In Leaked Email to Russia, Argentinian Official Decries ‘Very Critical’ Sputnik V Shortages
item.description: “At this point, the entire contract is at risk of being publicly canceled," the Argentinian official wrote.

item.title: Why Is Russia Arresting Pussy Riot Members?
item.description: The feminist punk rock and performance art collective has faced a growing string of detentions, self-imposed exiles and jail sentences in 2021.

item.title: In Doping Scandal, Russia Opts For 'Honorable Surrender'
item.description: Instead of going on the offensive, observers say, Moscow is preoccupied with mitigating the fallout from the reputational blow.

item.title: Russia in Talks to Help Tajikistan Build Afghan Border Outpost
item.description: Moscow is stepping up its activity in the region as the Taliban has captured swathes of Afghan territory from government forces.

item.title: With Cutting-Edge Hypersonics, Russia Leads in New Arms Race
item.description: "No one except Russia has hypersonic weapons but everyone wants them," said one analyst.

item.title: Russia Takes Ukraine to European Court Over Post-Annexation Grievances
item.description: The filing marks Russia's first-ever interstate complaint with the ECHR and includes a slew of offenses it says Ukraine has committed.

item.title: Russia ‘Successfully Disconnected’ From World Wide Web in Tests – RBC
item.description: Past attempts to unplug from the global internet have had mixed success.

item.title: Putin, Merkel 'Satisfied' With Near Completion of Nord Stream 2
item.description: The $12-billion pipeline is set to double Russian gas supplies to Germany but has been fiercely opposed by the U.S. and other European countries.

item.title: Russia Extends Navalny Spokeswoman's House Arrest
item.description: Kira Yarmysh has been under house arrest since February on accusations of breaching Covid-19 restrictions at a protest in Navalny's support.

item.title: U.S., Germany Pipeline Deal Warns Russia, Seeks Ukraine Transit
item.description: The pipeline through the Baltic Sea has been vigorously opposed by Ukraine.

item.title: Russian Tech Billionaire Durov Among Potential Pegasus Spyware Targets – Guardian
item.description: Durov, the founder of encrypted messenger Telegram, reportedly appears on the Pegasus list the year he changed his official residence to the UAE.

item.title: Kremlin Says Unbothered by Pegasus Spyware Revelations
item.description: Russia's top officials “use a special, reliably protected government communications system,” the Kremlin said.

item.title: Drowned Nigerian Student’s Russian Wife Says Faces Racist Online Attacks
item.description: The threats stem from a notorious nationalist and anti-women blogger who previously founded the “Male State” hate group.

item.title: ‘Worst Ever’ Air Pollution Event Hits Wildfire-Plagued Siberia
item.description: The concentration of pollutants in the air is far exceeding global standards in dozens of settlements.

item.title: Russia Unveils Stealth Fighter Jet to Compete With F-35s
item.description: The jet is described as a fifth-generation light single-engine fighter jet that incorporates "innovative solutions" including artificial intelligence.

item.title: Climate Change Is ‘Main Cause’ of Siberia’s Wildfires, Regional Head Says
item.description: Russia’s largest, coldest region has been under a state of emergency for nearly a month due to the wildfires covering hundreds of thousands of hectares.

item.title: Which Kremlin Critics Have Fled Russia?
item.description: Several prominent critics have left the country, are planning on leaving or have extended their stays abroad this year.

item.title: Russian Traffic Cop's Golden Toilet Steals the Show in Uncovered Police Bribe Scheme
item.description: Dozens of members of the Stavropol region's traffic police department have been apprehended following the scheme's uncovering.

item.title: Russia Shows Advanced S-500 Live Fire Test
item.description: The missile system is touted for its capability of intercepting stealth warplanes and destroying hypersonic weapons and satellites in near space.

item.title: Secret Underground Prison Reported Found Near St. Petersburg
item.description: The prison, disguised as a cottage, contained two cells and a human-sized crematory, according to footage published by St. Petersburg-based media.

item.title: Russian Tanks Move to Afghan Border Ahead of Drills
item.description: The troops will practice tasks of ensuring "the territorial integrity of Central Asian states," the Defense Ministry said.

item.title: Russia Shields Fraud-Plagued Space Agency From Foreign Scrutiny
item.description: The FSB argues the information on Roscosmos' work — as well as its problems — can be used against Russia by foreign states and organizations.

item.title: St. Petersburg Opposition Leader Battles 2 Namesakes in Upcoming Elections – Reports
item.description: Two other “Boris Vishnevskys” are now reportedly running for office after St. Petersburg opposition politician Boris Vishnevsky announced his run.

item.title: Russia to Hold Central Asia Army Drills Near Afghan Border
item.description: Russia said it will stage military drills next month with Tajikistan and Uzbekistan near Afghanistan's border where the Taliban has led a lightning offensive against government troops.

item.title: In Final Court Statement, U.S. Investor Calvey Says Acquittal Will Boost Russian Economy
item.description: Michael Calvey, a veteran foreign investor, faces a six-year suspended sentence on embezzlement charges that have rattled Russia's business community.

item.title: Russia Shows Tentative Willingness to Let U.S. Use Central Asia Bases
item.description: The arrangement — reportedly aired at the Biden-Putin summit — would involve U.S. forces using the Russian bases for operations in Afghanistan.

item.title: Scientists Say Russia Reaches 60% ‘Herd Immunity’ Through Vaccines and Infections
item.description: But the country will need to reach 90% to fully defeat the pandemic, scientists warned.

item.title: Kenya’s Failed Sputnik V Deal Used Emirati Resale Scheme
item.description: Documents obtained by The Moscow Times show a failed agreement used the same controversial resale deal linked to a royal middleman in the UAE.

item.title: Russia Test Fires Tsirkon Hypersonic Cruise Missile
item.description: The Tsirkon is part of an arsenal of futuristic weapons which Moscow hopes will give it the edge in any arms race with the United States.

item.title: News From Russia: What You Missed Over the Weekend
item.description: Siberian wildfires. Independent legal group disbands. Fleeing activist.

item.title: Russian Legal Group With Navalny Link Disbands
item.description: Team 29 is an association of lawyers and journalists fighting for freedom of speech in Russia and worked on high-profile espionage and treason cases.
